body_html:
Stumbled on this issue for a similar problem and realized I wasn't including the base includes from the protoc zip.

protoc-3.6.1-linux-x86_64.zip unzips with

~/bin/protoc$ ls -lh
total 1.4M
drwxr-xr-x 2 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 4.0K Jul 30 15:49 bin
drwxr-xr-x 3 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 4.0K Jul 30 15:49 include
-rw-rw-r-- 1 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 1.4M Nov  5 16:04 protoc-3.6.1-linux-x86_64.zip
-rw-r--r-- 1 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid  715 Jul 30 15:49 readme.txt

Which the readme does say

If you intend to use the included well known types then don't forget to
copy the contents of the 'include' directory somewhere as well, for example
into '/usr/local/include/'.

But who reads those?

If you don't add them into /usr/local/include you have to explicitly include them via protoc options

protoc -I ~/bin/protoc/include

Hope this helps someone.

body:
Stumbled on this issue for a similar problem and realized I wasn't including the base includes from the protoc zip.

protoc-3.6.1-linux-x86_64.zip unzips with

````
~/bin/protoc$ ls -lh
total 1.4M
drwxr-xr-x 2 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 4.0K Jul 30 15:49 bin
drwxr-xr-x 3 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 4.0K Jul 30 15:49 include
-rw-rw-r-- 1 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid 1.4M Nov  5 16:04 protoc-3.6.1-linux-x86_64.zip
-rw-r--r-- 1 mmacdermaid mmacdermaid  715 Jul 30 15:49 readme.txt
````

Which the readme does say
````
If you intend to use the included well known types then don't forget to
copy the contents of the 'include' directory somewhere as well, for example
into '/usr/local/include/'.
````

But who reads those?

If you don't add them into /usr/local/include you have to explicitly include them via protoc options
````
protoc -I ~/bin/protoc/include
````

Hope this helps someone.
